Introduction¶

Welcome to rp2Paths’s documentation. This project wraps the rp2Paths into a docker that may be called locally.

First build the docker using the following command:

docker build -t brsynth/rp2paths-standalone .

To call the docker locally you can use the following command:

python run.py -rp_pathways test/rp_pathways.csv -rp2paths_pathways test/out_paths.csv -rp2paths_compounds test/out_compounds.csv

API¶

class rpTool.run_rp2paths(rp2_pathways, timeout, logger=None)¶

Call the KNIME RetroPath2.0 workflow

Parameters

  • rp2_pathways – The path to the RetroPath2.0 scope results

  • timeout – The timeout of the function in minutes

  • logger – Logger object (Default: None)

  • source_bytes – str

  • sink_bytes – int

  • logger – logging

Return type

tuple

Returns

tuple of bytes with the out_paths results, compounds results, the status message, the command used

class run.main(rp_pathways, rp2paths_pathways, rp2paths_compounds, timeout=30, max_steps=0, max_paths=150, unfold_compounds=False)¶

Call the docker to run rp2paths

Parameters

  • rp_pathways – The path to the results RetroPath2.0 scope file

  • rp2paths_pathways – The path to the results rp2paths out_paths file

  • rp2paths_compounds – The path to the results rp2paths compounds file

  • timeout – The timeout of the function in minutes (Default: 90)

  • max_steps – The maximal number of steps WARNING: not used (Default: 0, ie. infinite)

  • max_paths – The maximal number of pathways to return WARNING: not used (Default: 150)

  • unfold_compounds – not sure WARNING: not used (Default: False)

  • rp_pathways – str

  • rp2paths_pathways – str

  • rp2paths_compounds – str

  • timeout – int

  • max_steps – int

  • max_paths – int

  • unfold_compounds – bool

Return type

None

Returns

None
